data.title: Who Is The Most Famous Ari In The World?
data.meta_description: The Who Is The Most Famous Ari In The World?, as voted on by fans. Current Top 3: Ari Gold, Ari Hoenig, Ari Up
data.text:
Voting Rules

Vote up all of the Aris you've heard of.

How many celebrities named Ari can you think of? The famous Aris below have many different professions, including notable actors named Ari, famous political figures named Ari, and even musicians named Ari.

Ari Graynor is certainly one of the most famous Aris on this list. One of the famous actresses named Ari, she is best known for her roles on such shows as I'm Dying Up Here, The Sopranos, and Fringe. She also appears in films like Whip It and For a Good Time, Call....

Another of the famous people with the first name Ari is Ari Shaffir. He is a comedian and actor. He created the TV series This Is Not Happening.

Did we forget one of your favorite famous people named Ari? Just add them to the list!

Birthplace : New York City, New York

Ari Gold (born February 11, 1974) is an American pop singer and songwriter. He is openly gay and regularly addresses both his being Jewish and gay, also starring in an autobiographic theater production, Ari Gold – Untitled: The Making Of A Gay Pop Star.

Birthplace : Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

Ari Hoenig (born November 13, 1973) is an American jazz drummer, composer, and educator.

Birthplace : Munich, Germany

Ariane Daniela Forster (17 January 1962 – 20 October 2010), known by her stage name Ari Up, was a German vocalist best known as a member of the English post-punk band The Slits.

Ari Brown (born February 1, 1944) is an American jazz tenor saxophonist and pianist. Brown grew up in Chicago and attended Wilson College, where he met musicians such as Jack DeJohnette, Henry Threadgill, Roscoe Mitchell, and Joseph Jarman. He played piano in R&B and soul outfits into the 1960s, then switched to saxophone in 1965. He joined the AACM in 1971, and also played with The Awakening in the early 1970s. In 1974 he lost several teeth in a car crash, and temporarily switched to piano again until he recovered. He played sax later in the 1970s with McCoy Tyner, Don Patterson, and Sonny Stitt. In the 1980s, he worked with Lester Bowie, Von Freeman, Bobby Watson, and Anthony Braxton, and in 1989 he became a member of Kahil El'Zabar's trio.

Birthplace : Lower Hutt, New Zealand

Ari Boyland (born 10 August 1987) is a New Zealand stage and television actor.

Birthplace : San Juan, Puerto Rico

Ari Meyers (born April 6, 1969) is an actress. She played the role of Emma Jane McArdle in the television series Kate & Allie (1984).
